title: Apple QuickTime SMIL qtnext Redirect File Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Apple QuickTime. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must open a malicious file.
The specific flaw exists in the handling of SMIL text embedded in video formats. No sanity checking is performed on values of the qt:next attribute. When the URI for this attribute is a file type not recognized by QuickTime, it is passed to url.dll!FileProtocolHandler which will allow explorer.exe handle non-http filetypes. Successful exploitation can result in the execution of arbitrary code.
addtionnal_details: Apple has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1222
timeline:
2008-05-08 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2008-06-10 - Coordinated public release of advisory
